document.docAuthor: Sun, Xin, Wu, Donghui & Gao, Meixiang
document.docTitle: Protaphorura maoerensis Sun, Wu & Gao, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of the octopunctata - group species of Protaphorura from China (Collembola: Onychiuridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of the octopunctata - group species of Protaphorura from China (Collembola: Onychiuridae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 14 – 20. Protaphorura maoerensis sp. nov.: 14, dorsal chaetotaxy; 15, PAO and anterior cephalic pso; 16, labium; 17, Ant. III sensory organ; 18, antenna; 19, distal part of leg III; 20, Abd. II – VI sterna. Scales: 0.1 mm (14, 19, 20), 0.01 mm (15 – 18).
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 21 – 26. Protaphorura maoerensis sp. nov.: 21, chaetotaxy of central part of Abd. V tergum; 22, ventral side of head; 23, Abd. IV – VI terga; 24, distal part of leg II; 25, chaetotaxy of central part of Abd. IV sternum; 26, anal valves. Scales: 0.1 mm (21 – 26).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype female, 13 paratypes females and 7 paratypes male on slides. China : Heilongjiang province: Maoershan National Forest Park (
45 ° 24 ’N
,
127 ° 40 ’N
), 0
1 June 2013
, litter and soil, Gao Meixiang leg.
Description. Body color white in alcohol. Size 1.75–2.05 mm in females, 1.75 mm in male; holotype 1.80 mm. Body slender and elongated.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 14–20.
Protaphorura maoerensis
sp. nov.
: 14, dorsal chaetotaxy; 15, PAO and anterior cephalic pso; 16, labium; 17, Ant. III sensory organ; 18, antenna; 19, distal part of leg III; 20, Abd. II–VI sterna. Scales: 0.1 mm (14, 19, 20), 0.01 mm (15–18).

FIGURES 21–26.
Protaphorura maoerensis
sp. nov.
: 21, chaetotaxy of central part of Abd. V tergum; 22, ventral side of head; 23, Abd. IV–VI terga; 24, distal part of leg II; 25, chaetotaxy of central part of Abd. IV sternum; 26, anal valves. Scales: 0.1 mm (21–26).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Appendages. Subcoxa 1 of legs I–III with 5–6, 6 – 7 and 6 chaetae, subcoxa 2 with 1, 5 and 5 chaetae, respectively. Tibiotarsi of legs I–III with 22 ( 11, 8 , 3 ), 24 ( 11, 8 , 5 ) and 23 ( 11, 8 , 4 ) chaetae, respectively (
Figs 19
&
24
). Unguis with inner denticle. Unguiculus slender and pointed, as long as inner edge of unguis, without inner basal lamella (
Figs 19
&
24
). Anal spines set on distinct papillae, 0.6 times as long as inner edge of unguis.
Etymology. The name of the new species refers to the mountain where it was found.
Ecology. In the mixed coniferous and broad leaved forest.

Remarks. The new species shares the character, subcoxa 1 of legs with 1 , 0, 0 pso respectively, with the octopunctata- group species
P. mongolica (Martynova, 1975 )
and
P. sakatoi (Yosii, 1966 )
. But they can be distinguished by the pso formula dorsally ( 43 /022/ 33353 in
P. maoerensis
sp. nov.
, 43 /022/ 33342 in
P. mongolica
, 43 /022/ 33343 in
P. sakatoi
).
P. maoerensis
sp. nov.
has the same pso formula dorsally 43 /022/ 33353 with the species
P. octopunctata (Tullberg, 1876 )
,
P. nutak (Yosii, 1972 )
,
P. eichhorni (Gisin, 1954 )
,
P. valsainensis (Acón, 1981 )
and
P. merita
Kaprus’ & Pomorski, 2008 . They can be separated by the combined characters in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Comparison of species with dorsal pso formula 43/022/33353 in the octopunctata- group of the genus
Protaphorura
.

tr.th: Chaeta s’ on Abd. I– III and V terga
P. m a oe re n si s sp. nov .

subSubSection.paragraph:
* The characters of
P. octopunctata
and P. nu t a k according to Kaprus’ and Pomorski ( 2008 ); the characters of
P. eichhorni
according to Weiner and Stomp ( 1995 ).
